alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Coastal York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued August 13 at 10:48PM EDT until August 14 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...High astronomical tides continue tonight. High water levels are expected, with some minor flooding possible in the most susceptible low lying areas. * WHERE...In Maine, Coastal York and Coastal Cumberland Counties. In New Hampshire, Coastal Rockingham County. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Seavey Island / Portsmouth NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.5 ft, Moderate 12.5 ft, Major 13.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.7 ft, Moderate 3.7 ft, Major 4.7 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 14/01 AM 10.2 1.4 0.2 1 None 14/02 PM 9.3 0.5 0.2 1 None 15/02 AM 9.7 0.9 0.0 1 None 15/03 PM 9.3 0.5 0.2 1 None 16/03 AM 9.4 0.6 0.2 1 None 16/03 PM 9.5 0.7 0.5 1-2 None Hampton Harbor NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.0 ft, Moderate 12.0 ft, Major 13.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 14/01 AM 10.5 1.0 0.2 1 None 14/02 PM 9.6 0.1 0.3 1 None 15/02 AM 9.9 0.4 0.0 1 None 15/03 PM 9.5 -0.0 0.2 1 None 16/03 AM 9.7 0.2 0.3 1 None 16/04 PM 9.7 0.2 0.6 1-2 None Portland ME MLLW Categories - Minor 12.0 ft, Moderate 13.0 ft, Major 14.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.3 ft, Moderate 3.3 ft, Major 4.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 14/01 AM 11.6 1.9 0.3 1 None 14/02 PM 10.6 0.9 0.3 1 None 15/02 AM 10.9 1.2 0.0 1 None 15/02 PM 10.4 0.7 0.2 1 None 16/03 AM 10.8 1.1 0.4 1 None 16/03 PM 10.6 0.9 0.5 1-2 None &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
